100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eKey Features\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eProxies all of the Buffer write and read functions\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeeps track of read and write offsets automatically\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGrows the internal Buffer as needed\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUseful string operations. (Null terminating strings)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows for inserting values at specific points in the Buffer\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBuilt in TypeScript\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eType Definitions Provided\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBrowser Support (using Webpack/Browserify)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFull test coverage\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRequirements\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNode v4.0+ is supported at this time.  (Versions prior to 2.0 will work on node 0.10)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBreaking Changes in v4.0\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-in-v40\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Breaking Changes in v4.0\" href=\"#breaking-changes-in-v40\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOld constructor patterns have been completely removed. (see \u003ca href=\"#offsets\"\u003eoffsets\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInternal private properties are now prefixed with underscores (_)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAll\u003c/strong\u003e writeXXX() methods that are given an offset will now \u003cstrong\u003eoverwrite data\u003c/strong\u003e instead of insert. (see \u003ca href=\"#write-vs-insert\"\u003ewrite vs insert\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003einsertXXX() methods have been added for when you want to insert data at a specific offset (this dir=\"auto\"\u003eBuilding a packet that uses the following protocol specification:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e[PacketType:2][PacketLength:2][Data:XX]\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo build this packet using the vanilla Buffer class, you would have to count up the length of the data payload beforehand. You would also need to keep track of the current \"cursor\" position in your Buffer so you write everything in the right places. With smart-buffer you don't have to do either of those things.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"function createLoginPacket(username, password, age, country) {\n    const packet = new SmartBuffer();\n    packet.writeUInt16LE(0x0060); // Some packet type\n    packet.writeStringNT(username);\n    packet.writeStringNT(password);\n    packet.writeUInt8(age);\n    packet.writeStringNT(country);\n    packet.insertUInt16LE(packet.length - 2, 2);\n\n    return packet.toBuffer();\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efunction\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ecreateLoginPacket\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan SmartBuffer.fromBuffer(buffer); // Creates instance from buffer. (Uses default utf8 encoding)\nconst buff = SmartBuffer.fromBuffer(buffer, 'ascii'); // Creates instance from buffer with ascii encoding for strings.\n\n// Creating SmartBuffer with specified internal Buffer size. (Note: this is not a hard cap, the internal buffer will grow as needed).\nconst buff = SmartBuffer.fromSize(1024); // Creates instance with internal Buffer size of 1024.\nconst buff = SmartBuffer.fromSize(1024, 'utf8'); // Creates instance with internal Buffer size of 1024, and utf8 encoding for strings.\n\n// Creating SmartBuffer with options object. dir="auto">smart-buffer is a Buffer wrapper that adds automatic read & write offset tracking, string operations, data insertions, and more.</p><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/4dd3ee8f008a6ad7e1c3dcc2380c7210f93b4499dc965ebed85c587ab57660b9/68747470733a2f2f6e6f6465692e636f2f6e706d2f736d6172742d6275666665722e706e673f646f776e6c6f6164733d7472756526646f776e6c6f616452616e6b3d747275652673746172733d74727565"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/4dd3ee8f008a6ad7e1c3dcc2380c7210f93b4499dc965ebed85c587ab57660b9/68747470733a2f2f6e6f6465692e636f2f6e706d2f736d6172742d6275666665722e706e673f646f776e6c6f6164733d7472756526646f776e6c6f616452616e6b3d747275652673746172733d74727565" alt="stats" title="stats" data-canonical-src="https://nodei.co/npm/smart-buffer.png?downloads=true&downloadRank=true&stars=true" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto"><strong>Key Features</strong>:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Proxies all of the Buffer write and read functions</li><li>Keeps track of read and write offsets automatically</li><li>Grows the internal Buffer as needed</li><li>Useful string operations. (Null terminating strings)</li><li>Allows for inserting values at specific points in the Buffer</li><li>Built in TypeScript</li><li>Type Definitions Provided</li><li>Browser Support (using Webpack/Browserify)</li><li>Full test coverage</li></ul><p dir="auto"><strong>Requirements</strong>:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Node v4.0+ is supported at this time.  (Versions prior to 2.0 will work on node 0.10)</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes in v4.0</h2><a id="user-content-breaking-changes-in-v40" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes in v4.0" href="#breaking-changes-in-v40"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ul dir="auto"><li>Old constructor patterns have been completely removed. It's now required to use the SmartBuffer.fromXXX() factory constructors.</li><li>rewind(), skip(), moveTo() have been removed. (see <a href="#offsets">offsets</a>)</li><li>Internal private properties are now prefixed with underscores (_)</li><li><strong>All</strong> writeXXX() methods that are given an offset will now <strong>overwrite data</strong> instead of insert. (see <a href="#write-vs-insert">write vs insert</a>)</li><li>insertXXX() methods have been added for when you want to insert data at a specific offset (this replaces the old behavior of writeXXX() when an offset was provided)</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Looking for v3 docs?</h2><a id="user-content-looking-for-v3-docs" dir="auto"><code>[PacketType:2][PacketLength:2][Data:XX]</code></p><p dir="auto">To build this packet using the vanilla Buffer class, you would have to count up the length of the data payload beforehand. You would also need to keep track of the current "cursor" position in your Buffer so you write everything in the right places. With smart-buffer you don't have to do either of those things.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="function createLoginPacket(username, password, age, country) {    const packet = new SmartBuffer();    packet.writeUInt16LE(0x0060); // Some packet type    packet.writeStringNT(username);    packet.writeStringNT(password);    packet.writeUInt8(age);    packet.writeStringNT(country);    packet.insertUInt16LE(packet.length - 2, 2);    return packet.toBuffer();}"><pre><span class="pl-k">function</span> <span class="pl-en">createLoginPacket</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">username</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> (Uses default utf8 encoding)const buff = SmartBuffer.fromBuffer(buffer, 'ascii'); // Creates instance from buffer with ascii encoding for strings.// Creating SmartBuffer with specified internal Buffer size. (Note: this is not a hard cap, the internal buffer will grow as needed).const buff = SmartBuffer.fromSize(1024); // Creates instance with internal Buffer size of 1024.const buff = SmartBuffer.fromSize(1024, 'utf8'); // Creates instance with internal Buffer size of 1024, and utf8 encoding for strings.// Creating SmartBuffer with options object.
